definitions.definition: the act of keeping something in good condition by checking or repairing it regularly

examples.text: The school pays for heating and the maintenance of the buildings.
She was working in the garden, doing weeding and general maintenance.
The building has received no regular maintenance since it was vacated in 2018.
The engine is designed for easy maintenance.
The power station has been shut down for essential maintenance.
We carry out routine maintenance of the equipment.
We provide a maintenance service on all our products.
The new system has reduced maintenance costs.
Keep warranty papers and maintenance records for any vehicle you own.

definitions.definition: the act of making a state or situation continue
the money needed for somebody's living expenses; the act of providing this money

examples.text: Most students need to take out loans for maintenance as well as tuition fees.

definitions.definition: money that somebody must pay regularly to their former wife, husband or partner, especially when they have had children together

examples.text: He has to pay maintenance to his ex-wife.
a maintenance order *(= given by a court of law)*

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘aiding a party in a legal action without lawful cause’): from Old French, from maintenir, from Latin manu tenere ‘hold in the hand’.
